intro: Mouretia tonkinensis var. inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal mouretia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
